title: Lag spikes!
body: riot pls fix this I'm having lag spikes even though i disconnected everything to the wifi and my wifi is wired. i've called the internet dude and fixed it but still i'm having lag spikes please fix this its so annoying.

replies.body:
Windows 10’s Game DVR feature can slow your gaming performance by recording video in the background. If you don’t care about recording your gameplay, disable Game DVR for performance reasons.

Unfortunately, Game DVR takes system resources. On a slower computer–or if you just want maximum graphical horsepower for your games–it can noticeably slow your in-game performance and lower your FPS. If you don’t care about recording your gameplay, you’ll want to disable this feature. This Game DVR feature may or may not be enabled by default, depending on your PC’s hardware.

Please disable both Game DVR and Game Bar.

To disable Game DVR, head to Settings > Gaming > Game DVR. Ensure the “Record in the background while I’m playing a game” option here is set to “Off”.

To disable the Game Bar, head to Settings > Gaming > Game Bar. Set the “Record game clips, screenshots, and broadcast using Game bar” option here to “Off”.

Hope this helped :D.

If its Lag issues you're experiencing then it could be that you need to switch your current DNS to the same DNS server Riot uses. 

Step 1. First of all, in your windows PC go to the Control Panel and select Network and sharing center.

Step 2. And there click on Change adapter settings.

Step 3. Now there you will see all networks, select the network that you want to configure for Google DNS.

If you have decided to try out Google’s DNS and want to change ethernet settings then simply right-click on Local Area Connection and then select Properties.

Step 4. Now click on Networking tab and there under This connection uses the following items select the option Internet Protocol Version 4 (TCP/IPv4) and then click on properties.

Step 5. Now choose the radio button Use the following DNS server addresses there and there will be written some default IP, simply clear them. Now there fill the value of google DNS value that is 8.8.8.8 OR 8.8.4.4 and then simply click on “OK” and then restart your network/computer.



That’s it! you are done. Let me know how you go on :D.
